channel.title: Homes on Wei Yang
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Wei Yang

item.description: Biography I am an assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at Dallas. I teach and do research on software engineering and security. Current Focused Research Areas: SE/Security for Machine Learning (PerInv, MRV, Telemade, NMTtest, ILFO, DENAS, EREBA, NICGSlowDown, NMTSloth, DeepPerform, TestAug) Mobile/Embedded System Security (WHYPER, Pluto, AppContext[1][2][3], Telemade, MRV, CLAP[1], EnMobile, MalScan, iRuler, TextExerciser, IntDroid, HomDroid, IFDroid ) Intelligent Software Testing/Security (ORBIT, WCTester[1][2], NMTtest[1], SemRegex[1], REINAM, TextExerciser, SCDetector, DBAntiPattern, UI-Flaky, WebEvo, Vet, GLIB, GameCompatStudy, VulCNN) I received my Ph.
